Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2009 11:43AM klp wrote: I had a lumpectomy and 33 rad tx that ended in January, 2009...I was told by my oncologist to come back in August for a mammo and check up. It will be about 7 months from my last radiation.
Posts.Title: Would love to hear from anyone who has had rads with lumpectomy kdholt koshka1

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2009 09:44AM - edited Mar 2, 2009 09:46AM by klp Didn't have chemo but did have 33 radiation treatments, 5 boosts. I didn't notice any tiredness or really anything out of the ordinary. Just got tiring going in each day. I am retired so if I had been working maybe I would have been fatigued..just don't know. I also continued to walk my dog each day and go to Curves 3 times/week. They said, whoever "they" is that exercise really helps to prevent fatigue.

Posts.Title: How long between diagnosis and surgery or treatment? Anxiousmama katiec

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 12:37PM klp wrote: I had the wire locator before my lumpectomy and I was more concerned with that then surgery. I worried for nothing. I had taken 10mg. Valium before arriving for the procedure and surgery at the suggestion of my BS.The procedure didn't hurt at all. Just a little needle prick from the lidocaine. I was also injected with a radioactive substance and the wire locator. I was bandaged up and taken by wheelchair to the hospital across the street for the sentinel node biopsy and surgery. Pretty much the same as Dukemom2 went thru. Hang in there, you'll be ok
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy rhodagrl JayeGA

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2009 01:56AM klp wrote: During my 33 rad tx I used emu oil after each treatment and before bed at night. I used Tom's deoderant after each session..no aluminum. I didn't burn or even get any redness.

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 07:02PM klp wrote: Hi skigrl, I went to my PT to have her tell me about lymphedema. I had 2 nodes removed and couldn't believe there could be a chance of LE with that node amount. She said it can come on years later and made it a point to tell me if I fly to wear a compression sleeve. I don't fly so no worry there. She gave me exercises to do while I do rads. That can bring on LE too. In your case I would rather be safe than sorry..you have 2 days to get one. Good luck.
Posts.Title: I am flying this week,uh oh lymphedema? skigrl kira

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 05:53PM klp wrote: I am also in total agreement with PatMom...I've had annual mammos each year. The last one I was called back and much to my total surprise a tumor was detected. I would rather have a little pain having a mammo then worrying and wondering if there is a ticking timebomb in my breast.
Posts.Title: I'm not actually worried, but I need some opinions KiminNewOrleansLA pk0199

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2008 11:12PM klp wrote: Allie....I had a script from my BS to get one Valium 10mg. I took that at 7am the morning of surgery before I left home.And before wire locator/radioactive substance they gave me before I was wheeled across the street to the hospital. I was joking and kidding the nurses and anyone around. The whole experience wasn't bad at all.
Posts.Title: Surgery's over, Now what? Firni lktracey

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 04:48PM klp wrote: Had my lumpectomy 10-24 after the wire locator. I was in a twilight sleep so never felt anything. I had Valium before the wire. I also was numb so it was nothing. That was my biggest worry. My only pain was the nurses trying to find a vein for the IV...felt like a pin cushion. I was shopping with my daughters at Walmart the next day..felt fine. Was even better when 2 days later I could take the bandages off and shower. Received the pathology report yesterday..clear margins, 2 nodes negative. I had the "Sentinel Node Biopsy" done so I didn't have to go thru the axillary node dissection. I will see my BS next Tues. for post-op and will discuss OncoType DX. The test will determine if I'll need chemo along with radiation and Arimidex.
Posts.Title: Surgery's over, Now what? Firni lktracey

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 06:42PM klp wrote: I had the same procedure done last month. The thought of wires being stuck into my breast made me worry much more than having the lumpectomy. I was prescribed one 10mg. Valium before I arrived for the procedure and surgery. I took it at 7am. The tech took more digital mammos to line up where the wires would be inserted. Radiologist came in, l minute later he was finished. Didn't feel a thing. Had to ask if he did it. Valium really does help. Best of luck tomorrow...after the procedure is finished you'll wonder why you wasted your time worrying. (((Hugs))))
